member.name: T:OllamaSharp.Chat
E:OllamaSharp.Chat.OnThink
member.summary: Event that gets fired for each token that the AI model is thinking. This will just work for models that support thinking according to their Ollama manifest and if Think is set to true. If Think is set to null, think tokens will be written to the default model output. If Think is false, think tokens will not be emitted.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Represents a struct that encapsulates a value for "think" that can either be a boolean (`true`/`false`) or a string like (`"high"`, `"medium"`, `"low"`) used for gpt-oss models.
member.remarks: This type provides implicit and explicit conversion operators between `bool`, `bool?`, and `string`, enabling flexible usage for boolean logic or predefined string-based levels.
member.example: Example conversion scenarios include initializing this value from a boolean, nullable boolean, or string, or interpreting its string representation.
member.threadsafety: This struct is immutable and thread-safe due to its readonly and value type nature.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Represents a struct that encapsulates a value for "think" which can be either a boolean or a predefined string value indicating levels such as "high", "medium", or "low".
member.remarks: This type provides implicit and explicit conversion operators to enable flexible usage with nullable booleans, booleans, and strings. It supports equality comparisons and ensures case-insensitive comparisons for string values.
member.threadsafety: This struct is immutable and thread-safe due to its readonly and value-type nature.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Represents a struct that encapsulates a "think" value, which can be a boolean (e.g., `true` or `false`) or a string representation of levels, such as `"high"`, `"medium"`, or `"low"`, commonly used in scenarios like gpt-oss models.
member.remarks: This type provides flexibility in the representation of values by supporting implicit and explicit conversions between `string`, `bool`, and `bool?`. The design facilitates usage in logic requiring predefined string levels or boolean states.
member.threadsafety: This struct is immutable and thread-safe due to its readonly nature and value-type implementation.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue.op_Implicit(OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue)~System.Nullable{System.Boolean}
member.summary: Defines a user-defined conversion from a ThinkValue to a nullable boolean. This operator attempts to convert the internal value of the ThinkValue instance to a nullable boolean. If the internal value is null, the result will be null. If the value can be parsed as a boolean, it will return the parsed boolean value. If it cannot be parsed, it returns false, ensuring safe handling of the conversion.
member.param: The ThinkValue instance to convert.
member.returns: A nullable boolean representation of the ThinkValue.

member.summary: Determines whether the current ThinkValue represents a boolean value.
member.returns: True if the value represents a boolean (true/false), otherwise false.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.ThinkValue.ToBoolean
member.summary: Converts the current instance to a nullable boolean value.
member.returns: A nullable boolean value representing the "think" state. Returns true, false, or null depending on the encapsulated value.
member.remarks: The conversion is based on the internal representation of the value within the instance. If the underlying value is a string that can be interpreted as a boolean, it will be converted. Otherwise, null may be returned.

member.summary: Appends a chat response stream chunk to the message under construction.

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.MessageBuilder.ToMessage
member.summary: Converts the current state of the message builder into a object.
member.returns:
A instance containing the following elements:
: The combined content built using appended chunks.
: The role assigned to the message.
: An array of image strings associated with the message.
: A collection of tool call objects associated with the message.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.MessageBuilder.Role
member.summary: Represents the role associated with a chat message. Roles are used to determine the purpose or origin of a message, such as system, user, assistant, or tool.

remarks.p: The property is typically used to indicate the sender's context or role within a conversation.

lu.li: User: Represents messages sent by the user.
Assistant: Represents messages generated by an assistant or AI model.
Tool: Represents messages or actions triggered by external tools.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.MessageBuilder.Images
member.summary: Represents the collection of image references included in a message.

remarks.p: This property contains a read-only collection of image file paths or URIs associated with the message content. The property is often utilized in scenarios where messages include supplementary visual content, such as in chat interfaces, AI-generated responses with images, or tools requiring multimedia integration.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.MessageBuilder.ToolCalls
member.summary: Represents the collection of tool calls associated with a chat message.
member.remarks:
The property is used to store references to external tools or functions invoked during a chat conversation. Tool calls can include various functions or actions that were triggered by the message. For instance:
Fetching data asynchronously from APIs.
Executing background processes.
Triggering integrations with third-party tools.
This property aggregates and holds all tool calls appended via the builder during message construction.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.Chat.MessageBuilder.HasValue
member.summary: Indicates whether the current instance contains any content, images, or tool calls.
member.remarks:
The property evaluates to true if:
The internal content builder has accumulated text.
There are any tool calls added to the .
There are images included in the .
Otherwise, it returns false.
This property is useful for verifying whether the builder contains meaningful data before processing further, such as converting it to a or appending additional elements to it.

member.name: T:OllamaSharp.Models.GenerateRequest
member.summary:
Generate a response for a given prompt with a provided model. This is a streaming endpoint, so there will be a series of responses. The final response object will include statistics and additional data from the request.

member.name: T:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption
member.summary: Collection of options available to Ollama
member.param: The name of the setting like defined in the Ollama api docs

member.name: M:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Collection of options available to Ollama
member.param: The name of the setting like defined in the Ollama api docs

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the Ollama setting

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.F16kv
member.summary: Enable f16 key/value. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: The penalty to apply to tokens based on their frequency in the prompt. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.LogitsAll
member.summary: Return logits for all the tokens, not just the last one. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.LowVram
member.summary: Enable low VRAM mode. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MainGpu
member.summary: This option controls which GPU is used for small tensors. The overhead of splitting the computation across all GPUs is not worthwhile. The GPU will use slightly more VRAM to store a scratch buffer for temporary results. By default, GPU 0 is used.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MinP
member.summary: Alternative to the top_p, and aims to ensure a balance of quality and variety.min_p represents the minimum probability for a token to be considered, relative to the probability of the most likely token.For example, with min_p=0.05 and the most likely token having a probability of 0.9, logits with a value less than 0.05*0.9=0.045 are filtered out. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MiroStat
member.summary: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MiroStatEta
member.summary: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MiroStatTau
member.summary: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Numa
member.summary: Enable NUMA support. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumBatch
member.summary: Prompt processing maximum batch size. (Default: 512)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumCtx
member.summary: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumGpu
member.summary: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumGqa
member.summary: The number of GQA groups in the transformer layer. Required for some models, for example it is 8 for llama2:70b

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumKeep
member.summary: Number of tokens to keep from the initial prompt. (Default: 4, -1 = all)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumPredict
member.summary: Maximum number of tokens to predict when generating text. (Default: 128, -1 = infinite generation, -2 = fill context)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.MaxOutputTokens
member.summary: The number of tokens to generate in the output. (Default: -1, infinite generation)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.NumThread
member.summary: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores).

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.PenalizeNewline
member.summary: Penalize newline tokens (Default: True)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.PresencePenalty
member.summary: The penalty to apply to tokens based on their presence in the prompt. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.RepeatLastN
member.summary: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.RepeatPenalty
P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Seed
member.summary: Sets the random number seed to use for generation. Setting this to a specific number will make the model generate the same text for the same prompt. (Default: 0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Stop
member.summary: Sets the stop sequences to use. When this pattern is encountered the LLM will stop generating text and return. Multiple stop patterns may be set by specifying multiple separate stop parameters in a modelfile.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Temperature
member.summary: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.TfsZ
member.summary: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (default: 1)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.TopK
member.summary: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.TopP
member.summary: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.TypicalP
member.summary: The typical-p value to use for sampling. Locally Typical Sampling implementation described in the paper https://arxiv.org/abs/2202.00666. (Default: 1.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.UseMlock
member.summary: Lock the model in memory to prevent swapping. This can improve performance, but it uses more RAM and may slow down loading. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.UseMmap
member.summary: Models are mapped into memory by default, which allows the system to load only the necessary parts as needed. Disabling mmap makes loading slower but reduces pageouts if you're not using mlock. If the model is bigger than your RAM, turning off mmap stops it from loading. (Default: True)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.VocabOnly
member.summary: Load only the vocabulary, not the weights. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.OllamaOption.Think
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to enable or disable thinking. Use reasoning models like OpenThinker, Qwen3, DeepSeek-R1, Phi4-Reasoning that support thinking when activating this option. (Default: Null)

member.name: T:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions
member.summary: The configuration information used for a chat completions request.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.MiroStat
member.summary: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.MiroStatEta
member.summary: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.MiroStatTau
member.summary: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumCtx
member.summary: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumGqa
member.summary: The number of GQA groups in the transformer layer. Required for some models, for example it is 8 for llama2:70b

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumGpu
member.summary: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.MainGpu
member.summary: This option controls which GPU is used for small tensors. The overhead of splitting the computation across all GPUs is not worthwhile. The GPU will use slightly more VRAM to store a scratch buffer for temporary results. By default, GPU 0 is used.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumBatch
member.summary: Prompt processing maximum batch size. (Default: 512)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumThread
member.summary: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores).

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumKeep
member.summary: Number of tokens to keep from the initial prompt. (Default: 4, -1 = all)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.RepeatLastN
member.summary: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.RepeatPenalty
P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.PresencePenalty
member.summary: The penalty to apply to tokens based on their presence in the prompt. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: The penalty to apply to tokens based on their frequency in the prompt. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.Temperature
member.summary: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.Seed
member.summary: Sets the random number seed to use for generation. Setting this to a specific number will make the model generate the same text for the same prompt. (Default: 0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.Stop
member.summary: Sets the stop sequences to use. When this pattern is encountered the LLM will stop generating text and return. Multiple stop patterns may be set by specifying multiple separate stop parameters in a modelfile.

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.TfsZ
member.summary: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (default: 1)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.NumPredict
member.summary: Maximum number of tokens to predict when generating text. (Default: 128, -1 = infinite generation, -2 = fill context)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.TopK
member.summary: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.TopP
member.summary: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.MinP
member.summary: Alternative to the top_p, and aims to ensure a balance of quality and variety.min_p represents the minimum probability for a token to be considered, relative to the probability of the most likely token.For example, with min_p=0.05 and the most likely token having a probability of 0.9, logits with a value less than 0.05*0.9=0.045 are filtered out. (Default: 0.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.TypicalP
member.summary: The typical-p value to use for sampling. Locally Typical Sampling implementation described in the paper https://arxiv.org/abs/2202.00666. (Default: 1.0)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.PenalizeNewline
member.summary: Penalize newline tokens (Default: True)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.UseMmap
member.summary: Models are mapped into memory by default, which allows the system to load only the necessary parts as needed. Disabling mmap makes loading slower but reduces pageouts if you're not using mlock. If the model is bigger than your RAM, turning off mmap stops it from loading. (Default: True)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.UseMlock
member.summary: Lock the model in memory to prevent swapping. This can improve performance, but it uses more RAM and may slow down loading. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.LowVram
member.summary: Enable low VRAM mode. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.F16kv
member.summary: Enable f16 key/value. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.LogitsAll
member.summary: Return logits for all the tokens, not just the last one. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.VocabOnly
member.summary: Load only the vocabulary, not the weights. (Default: False)

member.name: P:OllamaSharp.Models.RequestOptions.Numa
member.summary: Enable NUMA support. (Default: False)
